subject: IGCSE English Literature

overview.description: Cambridge IGCSE English Literature curriculum designed to develop appreciation for literature, critical analysis skills, and cultural understanding through study of diverse literary works

learning_objectives: Develop appreciation and enjoyment of literature from different cultures and periods
Master skills in literary analysis and critical interpretation
Understand literary techniques and their effects
Express ideas clearly and persuasively in written and oral form
Make connections between literature and broader cultural contexts

units.title: Poetry Analysis and Appreciation
learning_outcomes: Analyze poetic techniques and their effects
Understand different forms and structures of poetry
Compare poems from different cultures and time periods
Develop personal responses to poetry with textual support

lessons.title: Comparative Poetry Analysis: Themes Across Cultures
objectives: Compare treatment of universal themes in poems from different cultures
Analyze how cultural context influences poetic expression
Develop skills in comparative literary analysis

activities.description: Close reading of selected poems focusing on theme and technique
Group discussions comparing treatment of themes across cultures
Write comparative analysis paragraphs with textual evidence
Peer review and feedback on analytical writing

cross_curricular_connections: Global Perspectives: Cultural understanding and diversity

units.title: Drama Study and Performance
learning_outcomes: Understand social and historical contexts of dramatic works

lessons.title: Character Analysis Through Performance
objectives: Explore different interpretations through dramatic performance
Understand how performance choices affect meaning

activities.description: Analyze key characters using textual evidence and critical frameworks
Rehearse and perform key scenes with different interpretations
Compare different performance interpretations and their effects
Reflect on how performance enhances understanding

cross_curricular_connections: Performing Arts: Drama techniques and stagecraft
Psychology: Character motivation and human behavior

units.title: Prose Fiction Analysis
learning_outcomes: Understand cultural and social contexts of prose fiction

lessons.title: Narrative Technique and Reader Response
objectives: Analyze narrative perspective and its effects on reader understanding
Understand how authors manipulate reader response
Explore the relationship between narrative technique and theme

activities.description: Analyze narrative perspective and technique in key passages
Discuss how narrative choices affect reader interpretation
Rewrite passages from different narrative perspectives
Evaluate effectiveness of different narrative techniques

cross_curricular_connections: Media Studies: Narrative in different media forms

units.title: Literary Criticism and Independent Study
learning_outcomes: Apply different critical approaches to literary analysis
Conduct independent research on literary topics
Understand the role of context in literary interpretation

lessons.title: Independent Literary Investigation
objectives: Conduct independent research on chosen literary topic
Apply appropriate critical frameworks to analysis
Present findings in clear, well-structured format

activities.description: Plan independent research project with clear focus and methodology
Conduct research using primary and secondary sources
Synthesize research findings into coherent analysis

resources: Access to literary databases and criticism

poetry_selection: Poems from IGCSE Poetry Anthology representing diverse cultures
Contemporary and classical poetry from different continents
Poems exploring universal themes with cultural variations
Works by both established and emerging poets
drama_texts: Shakespeare plays (Romeo and Juliet, Macbeth, or others)
Modern drama from different cultural backgrounds
Plays exploring social and political themes
Works suitable for performance and analysis
prose_fiction: Novels and short stories from diverse authors
Works representing different time periods and cultures
Fiction exploring universal themes and human experiences
Texts suitable for detailed literary analysis

assessment_objectives: AO1: Show detailed knowledge and understanding of literary texts
AO2: Understand how writers achieve effects through language, structure and form
AO3: Explore relationships and comparisons between texts
AO4: Relate texts to their social, cultural and historical contexts
examination_structure: Paper 1: Poetry and Prose (1 hour 30 minutes, 50%)
Coursework Option: Portfolio of written work (100%)
assessment_skills: Close textual analysis with supporting quotations
Comparative analysis across texts and genres
Understanding of literary techniques and effects

formative_assessments: Weekly close reading exercises and annotations

textbooks: Cambridge IGCSE English Literature Complete Coursebook
Selected drama and prose texts for detailed study
digital_resources: Online literary databases and critical resources
Audio and video recordings of literary performances
supplementary_materials: Past papers and mark scheme collections

university_preparation.english_programs: Strong foundation for A-level English Literature and university study
university_preparation.humanities_disciplines: Critical thinking and analytical writing skills
university_preparation.creative_writing: Understanding of literary techniques and forms
university_preparation.international_recognition: Globally recognized qualification for university admission
